multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Endocrinology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing constipation and a decreased appetite for the past several months, and more recently, I've noticed an increase in the frequency of urination.
Have you noticed any changes in your weight recently?
No, I haven't mentioned any changes in my weight.
Do you have any family history of diabetes or thyroid issues?
I haven't mentioned any family history of diabetes or thyroid issues.
Are you currently taking any medications?
Yes, I'm currently taking hydrochlorothiazide, rifaximin, lactulose, and naproxen as needed for joint pain.
Have you experienced any changes in your thirst or in the appearance of your skin?
No, I haven't mentioned any changes in my thirst or the appearance of my skin.
Have you been diagnosed with any liver problems or other chronic conditions?
Yes, I have been diagnosed with alcoholic cirrhosis.
Final Diagnosis: Hepatorenal syndrome
